comments.body: When working with the multi-version API, I realized that by making the data initialization internal could save a lot of caller's effort.

See my other comment: it seems we initialize generationId / memberId as UNKNOWN anyways, which means that if enableFencing is false it would stay as `UNKNOWN_XX` and the broker would not check its generationId or memberId, so it seem we can get rid of the boolean flag indeed since if only groupId is passed in, the other fields' default value is sufficient to bypass the fencing.
Yep, we could just get rid of the check entirely, as for groupId based commit the other fields will all be default.
